posts.post_content:
THIS. THIS. THIS.  
  
I see this card and I think MUSTAFAR.  
  
THAT is what a Red Planeswalker should make me feel.  
  
God I want an Obi-Wan Kenobi card to fight him.....HEY!   
  
  
=D Maybe not my favorite decklists- and sadly I just really don't like Venser's new look-   
but this is the BEST pair of Planeswalkers to make a Duel Decks for since Jace vs Chandra! =D

posts.post_content:
@Antthemighty, mana always leaves your mana pool when you end your turn. Your mana pool is not the set of lands you have. Lands *produce* mana; they are not themselves mana.  
  
As for the art, I had pictured Koth as being more the earthy side of red, rather than the fiery side.

posts.post_content: i currently Run a Replicate based Izzet burn deck with [Chandra, the Firebrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra, the Firebrand) as my planeswalker but this guy is looking like a pretty attractive offset to her straight burn. he can just push my mana to its limits and i really can pump out the burn spells faster that way. on top of it all, his ult. could cover me if i get spell-screwed and need to stop a lifegain machine.
